meanings: to begin to fall out (e.g. hair)

related.meaning: setting a question (for an exam, quiz, etc.)
advance (into a new market, industry, etc.)
appearance (in a film, play, TV show, etc.)

lessons.japanese: 悪い習慣はいったん身につくと、抜け出すのが難しいことがある。
lessons.english: Once you've got into a bad habit, it can be difficult to get out of it.

lessons.japanese: この迷路は抜け出すのがとても難しい。
lessons.english: This maze is very hard to get out of.

lessons.japanese: あ、みんなには内緒だよ？寮を夜中に抜け出すのは厳罰だからね？
lessons.english: Oh, that's a secret, OK? Because slipping out of the dorm in the night is severely punished.

lessons.japanese: 私には、私達のかかえる困難から抜け出す道はないように思えた。
lessons.english: It seemed to me that there was no way out of our difficulty.

lessons.japanese: 私たちが困難から抜け出す方法はないように思える。
lessons.english: It seems that there is no way out of our difficulty.

lessons.japanese: 経済が今不振を抜け出すには時間がかかるだろう。
lessons.english: It will be some time before the economy will move out of the current doldrums.

lessons.japanese: 悪い習慣はいったん身につくと、抜け出すのが難しいことがある。
lessons.english: Once you've got into a bad habit, it can be difficult to get out of it.

lessons.japanese: この迷路は抜け出すのがとても難しい。
lessons.english: This maze is very hard to get out of.

lessons.japanese: 経済が今不振を抜け出すには時間がかかるだろう。
lessons.english: It will be some time before the economy will move out of the current doldrums.

lessons.japanese: 私たちが困難から抜け出す方法はないように思える。
lessons.english: It seems that there is no way out of our difficulty.

lessons.japanese: 私には、私達のかかえる困難から抜け出す道はないように思えた。
lessons.english: It seemed to me that there was no way out of our difficulty.

lessons.japanese: 教室を抜け出す少年の姿が目に入った。
lessons.english: I caught sight of the boy escaping from the classroom.

lessons.japanese: あ、みんなには内緒だよ？寮を夜中に抜け出すのは厳罰だからね？
lessons.english: Oh, that's a secret, OK? Because slipping out of the dorm in the night is severely punished.

lessons.japanese: トムは誰にも見られずに寮を抜け出すことはできなかった。
lessons.english: Tom couldn't sneak out of the dorm without being seen.
